posts.title: Port Richmond's Summer Reading Top Picks
posts.text: Throughout our Summer Reading Challenge, those who have been playing our Summer Reading Bingo have had the opportunity to push their reading boundaries and read new genres. We here at Port Richmond have also been expanding our literary horizons. Here are our top picks from the summer.

posts.title: Take the Summer Reading Challenge at Port Richmond Library
posts.text: We're inviting adults to play the Summer Reading Bingo game at Staten Island's Port Richmond Library: check off a square with every category of book you read.

posts.title: Put a Hold On It: Reserving the Latest DVDs
posts.text: Here's a #libraryhack to get on top of the holds list for the latest movies... who needs a streaming subscription?

posts.title: A Website Coding Starter Kit
posts.text: By following a few easy steps and making use of free resources and software, anyone can learn to create a website of their own.

posts.title: Clustered Resources on the California Gold Rush
posts.text: Whether you are an educator looking to diversify your lesson plans or a parent helping your child select materials for their upcoming report, clustering is a fun way to delve into any topic.

posts.title: Ten Tech Tips for Teens
posts.text: March 8–14, 2015 is Teen Tech Week, sponsored by the Young Adult Library Services Organization. In the spirit of the week, we would like to share some information for teens about devices, software, and internet resources.

posts.title: Preparing for the NYS Regents Exams
posts.text: For elementary and junior high school students, the week of January 26-30 will be a relaxing time off from school. For many high school students however, this week includes dreaded New York State Regents Exams. The New York Public Library offers helpful materials for last minute studying both in book and e-book form.
